data.title: Inequalities
data.statement:
Find the relation between each number or arithmetic expression and the next one.
If the first is smaller print the symbol {{<}} in between.
If the first is greater print the symbol {{>}} in between.
If they are equal print the symbol {{=}} in between.

Member of the inequality can be numbers (positive or negative) or arithmetic expression (addition, substraction, multiplication or division).
In case of arithmetic expression you should use the result to determine the relation with its neigboors but still print the expression in the final result.
data.constraints:
0 > [[N]] > 10

Division always gives rounded numbers.
<<No Parenthesis are used>>
Multiplication and division <<are not mixed>> with addition and substraction so <<you don't have to manage operator priority>>
data.stubGenerator:
read N:int
read values:string(256)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
Line 1 : [[N]] the number of terms in the inequality
Line 2 : [[N]] terms of numbers or arithmetic expression, space separated
data.outputDescription: The [[N]] terms given in input, separated by {{<}}, {{>}} or {{=}}

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Find the relation between each number or arithmetic expression and the next one.
If the first is smaller print the symbol < in between.
If the first is greater print the symbol > in between.
If they are equal print the symbol = in between.

Member of the inequality can be numbers (positive or negative) or arithmetic expression (addition, substraction, multiplication or division).
In case of arithmetic expression you should use the result to determine the relation with its neigboors but still print the expression in the final result.
Input
Line 1 : N the number of terms in the inequality
Line 2 : N terms of numbers or arithmetic expression, space separated
Output
The N terms given in input, separated by <, > or =
Constraints
0 > N > 10

Division always gives rounded numbers.
No Parenthesis are used
Multiplication and division are not mixed with addition and substraction so you don't have to manage operator priority
Example
Input
3
5 8 3
Output
5 < 8 > 3
